title: Wind Magnetic Fields Investigation: 3 sec, 1 min, and hourly Definitive Data. - A. Koval (UMBC, NASA/GSFC)

info.x_cadence_note: Cadence based on variable 'Epoch1' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/wind/mfi/mfi_h0/1994/wi_h0_mfi_19941113_v05.cdf. This most common cadence occurred for 100.0000% of the 23 timesteps. Cadence = 3600000 [ms] = PT1H.

parameters.name: Time
parameters.x_description: Time, Centered, Number of milliseconds since the epoch (1 hour)

parameters.name: B1F1LOG
parameters.description: Magnetic field magnitude (1 hour - log scaled). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B1F1']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: B1GSM
parameters.description: Magnetic field vector in GSM cartesian coordinates (1 hour)
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: Magnetic field vector in GSM coordinates (1 hour)

parameters.name: B1RMSGSM
parameters.description: RMS vector in GSM coordinates (1 hour)
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: RMS vector in GSM coordinates (1 hour)

parameters.name: B1GSE
parameters.description: Magnetic field vector in GSE cartesian coordinates (1 hour)
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: Magnetic field vector in GSE coordinates (1 hour)

parameters.name: B1GSEa
parameters.description: Magnetic field vector in GSE angular coordinates (1 hour). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function conv_pos1 (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B1GSE']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: Magnetic field vector in angular GSE coordinates (1 hour)

parameters.name: B1RMSGSE
parameters.description: RMS vector in GSE coordinates (1 hour)
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: RMS vector in GSE coordinates (1 hour)

parameters.name: DIST1
parameters.description: Distance from the center of the earth (Define Re = 6378km) (1 hour)

parameters.name: P1GSM
parameters.description: Position vector in GSM coordinates (Define Re = 6378km) (1 hour)

parameters.name: P1GSE
parameters.description: Position vector in GSE coordinates (Define Re = 6378km) (1 hour)

parameters.name: DIST1V
parameters.description: Time axis label: Distance from the center of the earth (Define Re = 6378km) (1 hour). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['DIST1']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: P1GSMV
parameters.description: Time axis label: Position vector in GSM coordinates (Define Re = 6378km) (1 hour). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['P1GSM']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: P1GSEV
parameters.description: Time axis label: Position vector in GSE coordinates (Define Re = 6378km) (1 hour). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['P1GSE']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
